event.name: START_BEACON_AEA_OLD_1
event.text: You pull yourself off the floor, in a daze. The ship cameras show most of the other crew doing the same, waking from their slumber. You remember the conflict you were just in with that strange vessel, but you find you're no longer under attack. Additionally you're being hailed by an unknown contact.

As you go to answer the hail, you realise the Ancient Alien that was hybernating on your ship has disappeared.
A strange species appears on screen. "Welcome to the Expanse, Unfortunately you stumbled upon something you're not meant to see, so we've taken you here, to be kept in exile for the rest of your natural life."
"I suppose theres no harm in explaining it. Do you want to hear the short version, or the longer explanation of why you're here?"

A strange species appears on screen. "Welcome to the Expanse, Unfortunately you stumbled upon something you're not meant to see, so we've taken you here, to be kept in exile for the rest of your natural life."
"I suppose theres no harm in explaining it. Do you want to hear the short version, or the longer explanation of why you're here?"

event.name: AEA_OLD_EXPLAIN_LONG
event.text: "A long time ago, before your federation, or rebellion there was just us, the Lylmiks. We expanded across the multiverse asserting our dominance over the other races, however as time went on our control became less effective and we started to lose. We started losing control over parts of the multiverse, the races we held under our thumb for so long began to band together and attack us."

"At the same time we developed the technology to render ourselves practically immortal, we stopped reproducing and began to recede back to our core. A split happened within our civilisation, one half wanted to release our control over the multiverse and to retreat to our core sectors to exist peacefully away from the rest of the multiverse. The otherside wanted the opposite, they wanted to redouble our efforts to control the multiverse."

"The conflict was long and drawn out, similar to your own conflict with the rebellion. Although we had rendered ourselves almost immortal, both sides took the time to develop weapons capable of ripping each other out of the multiverse. As a result our numbers were drained throughout the conflict, it was only once both sides had been reduced to the thousands that the conflict finally ended."

"The side that won was, as you may have guessed, the side that wanted to retreat from the multiverse. During the conflict major leaps in innovation were developped around Multiversal travel. One of those was the ability to quarantine certain realities. It was decided by the Lylmik council, the leaders of the Lylmik during the war, that we should quarantine ourselves, many of our species just wanted to be done with the multiverse."

"And so it was that we shut ourselves out of the multiverse. We knew however that our solution wasn't perfect, people may be able to discover the remnants of our empire much like you did. We implemented security features so that we could not only eliminate those that discover our secrets, but we could contain them here to keep track of them."

event.name: AEA_OLD_EXPLAIN_SHORT
event.text: "We, the Lylmiks were a race that existed a long time ago. We ruled the multiverse for a time, but as other races grew up we slowly lost control. Eventually we split due to this loss of control, and after a long civil war we quarantined ourselves away from the rest of the multiverse."
"Part of that quarantine was making sure that those who may discover us are eliminated from the multiverse, that means you."

event.name: AEA_OLD_EXPLAIN_AFTER
event.text:
"This is where we take those who stumble across our secrets, such as you. As a product of our quarantine you'll be trapped here forever, the only way anyone can leave is by going through the council and convincing them to let you leave. But good luck with that, the coordinates of the coreworlds where the council lives are only known to the most elite. The only person around here who has those coordinates is the *baron*."
"Anyway, I need to get back to my job. If you need anything else contact the guard." .
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_OLD_1_INTERACT
event.text: Normally a vessel of your calibre would be unexpected, however the guard here is clearly unimpressed. "If you think trying to destroy me will get you anywhere but dead, you're wrong."
The guard, upon verifying your Lylmik, transfers over a crate of supplies.
The guard immediately adopts a respectful posture when they see the council member aboard your ship, and transfers supplies over.

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
"I apologize, but we do not have orders to provide assistance to other ships."
The guard appears to take pity on you and agrees to your request. They transfer over a small crate of supplies.
The guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_OLD_1_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Lylmik guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_OLD_1_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Lylmik guard. Without crew on board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: AEA_OLD_1_BARON

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of the Baron.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: This is the location of the Baron.

event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover a large extravagant vessel, this must be the baron. If you destroy the vessel you should be able to recover the co-ordinates to the Lylmik coreworlds.
As you activate your weapons the Baron does the same.

event.name: AEA_OLD_BARON_DESTROYED
event.text: The extravagant vessel has been defeated. A substantial amount of scrap remains behind to take.
As you search the wreck for the coordinates of the Lylmik coreworlds you find an intact storage crate. A little while later you also find the coordinates.

choice.text: Use the coordinates immediately [WARNING: Do not use if your crew an onboard the baron's ship].
Give me a moment to prepare.

event.name: AEA_OLD_BARON_JUMP
event.text: Use the coordinates now?.

choice.text: Give me a moment to prepare.

event.name: AEA_OLD_OUTPOST
event.text: You find a Federation outpost at this beacon, broadcasting on a public channel. As you arrive the Federation commander onboard the station hails you. "A Federation Renegade eh, Haven't seen one of you around here in a long time. Either way, Welcome to our humble outpost, we serve the fragments of the federation fleet who get trapped here. Speaking of, we recently discovered a field of Lylmik tech, it must have been hit pretty hard for it fragmented into many many pieces. We've collected the pieces but have been unable to find anything useful amongst them, perhaps you'd be interested?"
You arm the weapons and engage the station!

event.name: STORE_HOSTILE_AEA_OLD
event.text: Surprisingly a Lylmik merchant appears to be under attack from a heavily armed elite, If you want to trade with them you'll need to take care of the elite.
You prepare for combat.
Fortunately, the Elite remain oblivious to your presence.

event.name: AEA_OLD_FREE_ELITE
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover a Lylmik vessel in orbit, there appears to be a small shuttle attached to the side of the ship.

A lylmik appears on your screen "Captain, I don't suppose you want a new crewmember. We've had a pretty incredible event onboard, this person tried to take over our ENTIRE ship by themselves, completely on their own. Normally we'd have killed them immediately, however the sheer gaul to attempt something like this has saved their life. Anyway we've gotten a bit bored of the prisoner, do you want them?"
"Fantastic, we'll send them over." A moment later a shuttle is remotely piloted over to your ship, and onboard is an elite crewmember.
The lylmik ship ignores you.

event.name: AEA_OLD_STORE_EXCLUSIVE
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover an unmarked Lylmik merchant station. As you get closer a message plays from the station. "Welcome to the Marketplace Captain, an exclusive club for rich and dangerous ships, if you can't prove your might, you're better off turning back." You then get a popup telling you membership is ONLY 29.99~. .
You gain access to the station, and discover its basically just one big store.
This is clearly a scam, getting rid of them will be a service to the sector.
You're not going to get involved in whatever this is.

event.name: AEA_OLD_CRATE_ITEM
event.text: You've arrived at a relatively empty beacon, however your sensors pickup a large storage crate floating around in orbit near the beacon.
You prepare your jump drive for the next jump.
You secure the crate into your cargo before openning it up, you discover the crate contained a large Lylmik weapon.
You secure the crate into your cargo before openning it up, you discover the crate contained a hybernating Lylmik. Upon waking up to your intrusion they offer to join your crew.
You secure the crate into your cargo before openning it up, you discover the crate contained a pristine drone.

event.name: EMPTY_AEA_OLD
event.text: An Empty Beacon...
You power up your weapons and fight the Lylmik ship.
You decide not to fight the Lylmik vessel, and fly away.

textList.name: TEXT_AEA_OLD_CHOICE
textList.text: The Lylmik ship at this beacon has not yet noticed your presence. If you wanted, you could fly away safely, or attack now and take them by surprise.
"You're lucky I'm not one to kill those I meet at random, you should leave before it's no longer random."
You've caught a Lylmik vessel unaware of your presence, they'll be worth quite a bit of scrap if you can kill them.

event.text: You power up your weapons and fight the Elite ship.
You decide not to fight the Elite vessel, and fly away.

textList.name: TEXT_AEA_OLD_CHOICE_MU
textList.text: Another detainee is located at this beacon, they don't seem interested in attacking you.
"Captain, We don't want any trouble but if you force it we won't hold back"
You've caught another vessel trapped in Lylmik space off gaurd and they haven't noticed you yet.

event.name: AEA_OLD_COLONY
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover an entire civilian space station sitting in orbit around this beacon, you wonder how the Lylmiks even managed to bring it here.
The station responds quickly, "Please. you've got to help us. Theres some maniac running around who keeps trying to destroy us, they'll be back at any moment."

choice.text: Help them deal with the threat.

event.text: It only takes a short while later before the ship shows up, you move in to block it's route to the station.
You prepare for the next jump.
You prepare for the next jump.

event.name: AEA_OLD_COLONY_WIN
event.text: "Thank the Lylmik you were here to save us, here have some supplies."

event.name: AEA_OLD_LIZZARD
event.text: Waiting for you at the beacon is a Lylmik vessel, your sensors pickup the crew scavenging the nearby debree field for parts, it isn't clear exactly what they're looking for.
The Lylmik barely pays attention to you as they pick up the hail "Buzz off stupid Renegade."

choice.text: (Unique Crew)"Hang on we might have something you'll be interested in!"

event.text: "Hmm, perhaps you're right, what do you want for it?"
"An acceptable deal."

removeCrew.text: They're just gone not dead. Yet.

event.text: It is only a moment after you deliver your crew over that you hear muffled screaming in the background, aswell as the clunk of heavy machinery...

choice.text: A bunch of scrap and a replacement crewmember.

event.text: "An acceptable deal."
It is only a moment after you deliver your crew over that you hear muffled screaming in the background, aswell as the clunk of heavy machinery...

choice.text: "What about all this scrap we have?"

event.text: "Hmm, perhaps you're right, how about we give you a weapon we got from this weird ship we captured..."

event.name: AEA_OLD_LIZZARD_NEVERMIND
event.text: You decide not to interrupt the Lylmik vessel any further and fly away.
You decide not to interrupt the Lylmik vessel and fly away.

event.name: AEA_OLD_ONCEUPONABAN
event.text: You discover a strange device sitting in orbit around the beacon, it appears Lylmik in design.

choice.text: Poke at what appears to be a button.

event.text: A moment after it disapears you pickup a Lylmik jumping to the beacon. "Hey dude, that's not very cool of you, prepare to die."
You decide not to mess with the device.
The device opens like a flower and inside is revealed to be a Lylmik weapon.
The device opens like a flower and inside is revealed to be a drone.
The device opens like a flower and inside is revealed to be a Lylmik crewmember who offers to join your crew.
The device starts beeping and flashing red. You manage to make it back to the ship just in time for it to explode and damage your hull.
The device starts beeping and flashing red. You manage to make it back to the ship just in time for it to spit out three Lylmiks who promptly board you ship.

event.name: AEA_OLD_MFK_SAVE
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover a small MFK shuttle being battered about by a Lylmik vessel. The rebel shuttle attempts to hail you.
"Please get me out of here, those stupid aliens having been playing with me. I'll join your crew if only you let me repay those scum."
"This is why all xenos deserve death." Clearly the Lylmik's have a similar idea as they move to attack.
You decide not to interfere in the Lylmik's fun.
You decide not to interfere in the Lylmik's fun.

event.name: AEA_OLD_LYLMIK_GONE
event.text: You're confronted by a Lylmik vessel as you arrive at the beacon, it only takes you a moment to realize the ship is almost completely powered down.

choice.text: Attack the vessel while it's powered down.

event.text: As you activate your weapons the enemy ship comes online in response.
You fly away and decide not to mess with the ship.
As it turns out, the crew of the ship were actually just asleep. They come back online and immediately activate their weapons in your general direction.

After a while, there are still no signs of life from the ship... literally, in fact, as closer inspection of the ship's scans reveal no one is on board. Sensors did pick up what appears to be a note taped to the ship, reading "Went on an errand, be back in about 200 years." You're able to salvage the vessel with no risk.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AEA_OLD_1_FIGHT
textList.text: A large vessel approaches you, it appears they're interested in getting their hands on any of the new tech you might have on your ship.
It's clear the ship moving in to attack you has only survived so long from being incredibly dangerous.
The only way to survive trapped in this section of the Multiverse is to take resources from others, and theres a survivor approaching you now.
Although against killing themselves, the Lylmik do nothing about keeping citizens of their realm from killing each other. As it happens a citizen moving into an attack position.
